content: I'm trying to find my way here again and see how I can help people with my skills by starting slowly. Starting with a simple but important service for specific people.Perfect translations, done manually to ensure accurate context.5 cents per word.Fluent in Spanish, German, English, Dutch, and French.Other languages may be possible. Please contact me for more information.All translations will be proofread by a native language speaker."I'm offering some freebies to individuals who are well-known and trusted here.PM me for info or feel free to ask your questions here.

comments.author: Porfirii
comments.body: Although the conflict of interests is obvious, I can't help but give my honest opinion:Hamich124D's comment is on point: translation services should be offered by native speakers; otherwise, you should warn about the need of hiring a proofreader, with the consequent price reduction. Â I'm fluent in Spanish, Basque and English, and have intermediate knowledge on French and German, but I wouldn't dare to translate into languages apart from Spanish and Basque (because I'm a native bilingual of both languages). Not even in English, because I'm well aware that I make mistakes that wouldn't be overlooked by native speakers even though I have provable Proficiency level.That said, such a multilinguality, although possible, is hard to believe; if I were to pay 5 cents per word, I would expect a native translator to do the job. So I get that you're trying to find your way here and I hope you good luck, but focus on what you do best if you want to build a reputation.

comments.author: Freedom4All
comments.body: Indeed.I added it to my OP."All translations will be proofread by a native language speaker.". So for other languages where I have no native proofreader for, I need to inform. No, autotranslate tools which is not ethic and gives bad results.
